title: spec: short variable declarations are not shorthand for regular variable declarations
body:
by **gnormington@gopivotal.com**: 
According to http://golang.org/ref/spec#Short_variable_declarations, a short variable
declaration "is shorthand for a regular variable declaration with initializer
expressions but no types". However, this is contradicted by the next paragraph
which says that short variable declarations are distinguished from regular variable
declarations in that they alone can redeclare variables.

It may be better to reword this section to say a short variable declaration "is
similar to a regular variable declaration with initializer expressions but no types,
except that it may redeclare variables in the same block providing it declares at least
one new, non-blank variable". (The definition of redeclaration should also continue
to be provided separately.)
